name: pubsub-5.1.1
body:
### Features
Enable prometheus metrics in pubsub (#425).

Please note that Prometheus metrics will replace the current usage of
a manually-created `MetricsAgent` class, which is now marked as
deprecated.

---

Note that v5.1.1 is a re-release of v5.1.0, which had a deployment issue.

name: bigquery-6.1.2
body:
### Bugfixes
Fixup query parsing for nested RECORDs. Thanks @harsh-dialpad for the insights!

name: bigquery-6.1.1
body:
### Features
Add new convenience function (`query_response_to_dict()`) for converting responses to dicts (#486).

Example usage:
```python
resp = await job.query(...)
print(query_response_to_dict(resp))
```

NOTE: there was no `bigquery v6.1.0` release due to a build error. `v6.1.1` is a re-release which includes a fix for the Python 2.x builds.

name: pubsub-5.0.1
body:
### Fixes

Pubsub's ``SubscriberClient.list_subscriptions()`` method has been updated to support pagination. Fixed bug where if you had more than 100 (default) subscriptions, it would not return all of them. (#489)

name: auth-4.0.1
body:
### Internal
- broaden support for `backoff` versions (mark v2.x as supported)

name: datastore-7.1.0
body:
### Features
Add support for cursors on GQL queries (#459) - thanks @javierdialpad!

name: taskqueue-5.0.0
body:
### Internal
Migrate to using `poetry` as a package manager (#443)

We've done our best to avoid having this cause any breaking changes, but with such a large change we decided to be safe. Please report any packaging issues you come across and we'll get them resolved as soon as we can!

Fix a missing link to the `backoff` library (#408)

Use BytesIO in `gcloud-aio-storage` on upload to support >1MB multipart data (#441) -- thanks @[bruchar1](https://github.com/bruchar1)!

### Internal
Migrate to using `poetry` as a package manager (#443)

We've done our best to avoid having this cause any breaking changes, but with such a large change we decided to be safe. Please report any packaging issues you come across and we'll get them resolved as soon as we can!

We've done our best to avoid having this cause any breaking changes, but with such a large change we decided to be safe. Please report any packaging issues you come across and we'll get them resolved as soon as we can!

### Docs

name: kms-4.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
Do not convert `decode()` result to `str` (#363) 

This method now returns the unmodified `bytes`, in order to support non-utf8 usecases. To keep the original behaviour, please call `.decode()` on the return value.

### Internal
Migrate to using `poetry` as a package manager (#443)

We've done our best to avoid having this cause any breaking changes, but with such a large change it's entirely possible. Please report any packaging issues you come across and we'll get them resolved as soon as we can!

We've done our best to avoid having this cause any breaking changes, but with such a large change we decided to be safe. Please report any packaging issues you come across and we'll get them resolved as soon as we can!

We've done our best to avoid having this cause any breaking changes, but with such a large change we decided to be safe. Please report any packaging issues you come across and we'll get them resolved as soon as we can!

name: pubsub-4.5.0

- No ack deadline cache refresh by default (#370) -- thanks @shaundialpad!
- Expose type hints (#368)

### Bugfixes

- Fixup some invalid tests (#387) -- thanks @TheKevJames!
- Fixup type hint in `PubsubMessage` (https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/commit/15ed76f63aa4d4e2e91286588aa1f34c5d2741b4) -- thanks @TheKevJames!

name: storage-6.3.0

- export `timeout` parameter for `Blob.download()` (#398)

### Bugfixes
- load aiofiles into memory on upload, which should allow `upload_from_filename()` to be used with temporary files once more
- correctly encode object name for `patch_metadata()` calls, which should fix this function for objects with non-ascii names (#395)

name: auth-3.7.0
body:

- use `aiohttp.ClientTimeout` directly -- this should avoid some compatibility issues with `aiohttp`
- avoid closing shared session objects (#367)

### Performance
- avoid unnecessarily instantiating `aiohttp.TCPConnector` objects

name: auth-3.6.2
body:
### Performance
- avoid unnecessary TCPConnector init (#388)

name: bigquery-5.3.0
body:
### Features

This release includes a large set of new API functionality -- thanks @BoweiYuanDialpad for all the hard work!

The following new APIs have been implemented:
1. insert job
2. synchronous query
3. create table via API call instead of DDL
4. patch table
5. list tables in a dataset
6. lsit datasets in a project
7. describe a dataset
8. insert a new dataset

name: taskqueue-4.2.1
body:
### Bugfixes
- use new Session APIs for pushqueues (#347)

This should avoid cases where an AttributeError can be raised if the timeout value is not specified when calling PushQueue methods.

name: storage-6.1.0
body:
### Features
- support setting custom metadata on resumable upload (#344) -- thanks @gagphil1 !
- support setting non-string custom metadata keys (#344) -- thanks @gagphil1 !

   Note that custom metadata does still need to be stringifiable, eg. we will be calling `str()` on it. This should work out-of-the-box for passing in, eg. lists and dictionaries.

name: datastore-6.3.0
body:
### Features
Support creating a mutation from Value objects (#350) -- thanks @KevinGDialpad !

This allows `make_mutation()` to accept `Value` properties directly in addition to being able to infer them from builtin Python types, which should allow you to create more advanced mutations, such as those with values excluded from indexes:
```python
properties = {
    'active': True,
    'data' : Value(data, exclude_from_indexes=True),
}
key = Key(settings.GCLOUD_PROJECT_ID, [PathElement('MyEntity')])
await client.insert(key, properties)
```

name: datastore-6.2.3
body:
### Bugfixes
- ensure `Query.from_repr()` can reverse `to_repr()` output (#343) -- thanks @todddialpad !

name: datastore-6.2.2
body:
### Bugfixes
- fix support for empty `Array` values in query responses

name: storage-6.0.0
body:
### BREAKING CHANGES
- bugfix: fixup blob signing (#323)

Note that this fix represents a backwards incompatible change as the `Storage.get_signed_url()` method has had several arguments removed and now runs the signing client-side rather than via RPC to Google's infrastructure. The new method signature is:
```python
async def get_signed_url(
    self,
    expiration: int,
    headers: Optional[Dict[str, str]] = None,
    query_params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
    http_method: str = 'GET',
    token: Optional[Token] = None
) -> str:
```

name: pubsub-4.4.0
body:
### Features
- add async context manager to SubscriberClient (#324)

name: bigquery-5.2.0
body:
### Features

* Added `Job.result()` to implement waiting on `Job` result, raising an exception on errors returned by BigQuery or if the query job is still pending completion. (#234) (Thanks to @DaniilAnichin for the contribution)
* Added optional `params` on `Job.get_query_results()` to pass through HTTP params to the underlying `GET` request to BigQuery. (#319)

Adding `params` to `Job.get_query_results()` enables use cases such as results pagination ([and a variety of others](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs/getQueryResults)):

```python
params = {'maxResults': 100}
results = await job.get_query_results(params=params)
rows = results['rows']
page_token = results.get('pageToken')
 
while page_token:
    params['pageToken'] = page_token
    results = await job.get_query_results(params=params)
    page_token = results.get('pageToken')
    rows.extend(results['rows'])
```

name: storage-5.7.0
body:
### Features
* add headers param to all methods -- thanks @domZippilli !
      The `headers: Optional[Dict[str, str]] = None` is now attached to all `Storage()` methods and can be used to pass additional headers to the Google API.
* implement multipart upload -- thanks @AlexisH !
       The `Storage.upload()` method now supports an `UploadType.MULTIPART` specifier to enable multipart object uploads. Additionally, the MULTIPART strategy will be selected automatically when object metadata is provided.
* use non-blocking aiofiles (#315) -- thanks @jackton1 !
       The `Storage.upload_from_filename()` and `Storage.download_to_filename()` methods have been updated to make use of a thirdparty library for writing to files when using `gcloud-aio-storage` -- those writes should now use asyncio IO-waiting semantics.
* add ability to make patch request to object metadata (#310) -- thanks @eddiedialpad !
       `Storage.patch_metadata()` has been created, which allows users to patch object metadata according to [Google's options](https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/json_api/v1/objects/patch).
* support streamed download responses (#307) -- thanks @domZippilli !
       `Storage.download_stream()` has been created, which allows users to download objects in a streaming fashion, eg. as an IO-style object which allows you to call `read(chunk_size)` to read the results piecemeal.
 
### Internal
* updated doc links to encoding URI path (#317) -- thanks @jackton1

name: auth-3.6.0
body:
### Features
- add support for streaming get requests (via `SyncSession().get(..., stream=True)`

name: auth-3.5.0
body:
### Features
Add new `Session.patch()` method for making HTTP PATCH requests (#311) -- thanks @eddiedialpad !

name: pubsub-4.3.4
body:
### Bugfixes
Fixed subscriber pull timeout key error (#294) -- thanks @Sinusoidal36 !

`gcloud.aio.pubsub.subscriber_client.pull()` throws a key error when the request times out. This can occur if there are no messages in the subscription. This release includes a simple fix to default to an empty list when no messages are received.

name: pubsub-4.3.3
body:
### Bug fix (internal)

* Messages were sometimes redelivered to the SubscriberClient on shutdown. Fixed in #304.

name: pubsub-4.3.2
body:
### Internal improvements

* Improve logging and exception handling in ack/nack failure scenario. (#302)

name: pubsub-4.3.1
body:
### Bug Fixes
* Improve the way pubsub `subscribe` function handles errors from a server. Fixed in #298

name: pubsub-4.3.0
body:
### Features

Add `delivery_attempt` to `SubscriberMessage` on construction as an optional parameter to pick up the `deliveryAttempt` field from pulled PubSub messages. This represents "the approximate number of times that Cloud Pub/Sub has attempted to deliver the associated message to a subscriber" [1] but is only set on subscriptions that have a deadletter policy configured. It is otherwise zero (`0`). (#293)

[1] https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.subscriptions/pull#receivedmessage

name: pubsub-4.2.1
body:
### Bug fixes

* Messages pulled from a subscription may have no `attributes` or `data` field, which fails expectations. Fixed in #291.

name: pubsub-4.2.0
body:
### Features

* Add [orderingKey](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/reference/rest/v1/PubsubMessage) to `PubsubMessage` on construction as an optional parameter. When set, all messages that are published with the same key will have their insertion order preserved when pulling them from the subscription. Learn more about [ordering PubSub messages](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/ordering). (#264)

### Internal improvements

* Disable SSL/TLS verification when running against PubSub emulator host. (#289)
* Use `application/json` for all `PublisherClient` HTTP requests. (#289)

name: pubsub-4.1.0
body:
### Features

* `PublisherClient` now has additional methods (analogous to `SubscriberClient` methods) `list_topics`, `create_topic`, `delete_topic` (https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/pull/286).

### Bug fixes

* Timeouts on `SubscriberClient.pull` (10 seconds by default) allow the PubSub subscription to still send messages through the abandoned HTTP connection where the messages subsequently expire. Fixed in https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/pull/287.

name: pubsub-4.0.4
body:
### Reversion

This release reverts changes in `4.0.3` to avoid closing the `session` on a `subscriber_client` that could be re-used in other `subscribe` calls (or elsewhere).

name: pubsub-4.0.3
body:
### Minor changes

Changeset #282 closes the `gcloud.aio.auth.{Aio,Sync}Session` of the `subscriber_client` on `subscribe` shutdown.

name: pubsub-4.0.2
body:
### Bug fix

Changeset https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/pull/280 fixes a deadlock in the `subscribe` method while shutting down internal components gracefully.

name: pubsub-4.0.1
body:
### Internal changes

Changeset #277 implements graceful shutdown for internal producer, consumer, and acker workers within `subscribe` to ensure internally queued messages are flushed (i.e. either `ack`ed or `nack`ed).

name: pubsub-4.0.0
body:
### Features (BREAKING)

Changesets #243, #265, #270, and #271 introduce the following changes:

- Deprecates the underlying `google-cloud-pubsub` implementation of `SubscriberClient` (which used gRPC under the hood) in favour of an HTTP implementation (both with `asyncio` and without) that uses Google PubSub's REST API with the ability to pull N messages directly (without specifying a callback) via `client.pull`
- Migrates actions on `SubscriberMessage` into `SubscriberClient` as `client.acknowledge` and `client.modify_ack_deadline`
- Introduces other REST API calls on `SubscriberClient`: `delete_subscription`, `get_subscription`, and `list_subscriptions`
- Migrates `SubscriberClient.subscribe` to standalone async function `subscribe`, which uses the new HTTP implementation of `SubscriberClient` and similarly runs a user callback on dynamically-pulled PubSub messages but on the `asyncio` event loop instead of a thread pool
- Deprecates non-async `SubscriberClient.subscribe` method
- Deprecates `FlowControl` in favour of tunable flow control via `subscribe` function parameters
- Tunable ack and nack behaviour in `subscribe` via `ack_window`, `ack_deadline_cache_timeout`, and `nack_window`
- Metrics collector injectable into `subscribe` as an instance of `MetricsAgent` (supports Datadog metrics client interface out-of-the-box)

A complete description of the new `SubscriberClient` and the associated `subscribe` function can be found in the [README](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/blob/pubsub-4.0.0/pubsub/README.rst).

name: auth-3.4.5
body:
### Internal
Forcibly pins the dependency of a dependency, which may fix installation with naive dependency resolvers (such as the one used in `pip<20.3.0`)

name: datastore-6.2.1
body:
### Features
* expose `MutationResult` publically as `datastore.MutationResult` (#259) -- thanks @KevinGDialpad!

### Bugfixes
* handle case where commit API doesn't return `indexUpdates` (#261) -- thanks @KevinGDialpad!

### Internal
* narrow type hint for `Array` ctor (#260) -- thanks @KevinGDialpad!

name: datastore-6.2.0
body:
### Features
* return `MutationResults` data on any commit -- this means any methods such as delete/insert/update/upsert/etc will return their results upon completion (#240) -- thanks @KevinGDialpad!

### Documentation
* fixup some typos in our examples (#191) -- thanks @zhuny!

### Compatibility
* add explicit tests and mark compatibility for Python 3.9 (no issues found -- previous versions should work fine!)

name: auth-3.4.4
body:
### Minor changes

* `params` argument is now optional for both `AioSession.delete()` and `SyncSession.delete()` (#245)

name: bigquery-5.1.0
body:
### Features

- Added support for `dryRun` and `useQueryCache` parameters in `Table.insert_via_query`
- Added `Job.insert_via_query`, which has the same implementation as the updated `Table.insert_via_query`

### Marked for deprecation

- `Table.insert_via_query` is marked for deprecation; please use `Job.insert_via_query` instead

name: bigquery-5.0.0
body:
### Features (BREAKING)

https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/pull/224 introduces the following changes:

Add option `ignore_unknown_values` to `Table.insert_via_load` which, when specified, ignores any values in a row that are not present in the table schema. Also introduce `SchemaUpdateOption` which can be used in `Table.insert_via_load`:

- `ALLOW_FIELD_ADDITION` -- allow new fields to be added
- `ALLOW_FIELD_RELAXATION` -- allow relaxing `REQUIRED` fields to `NULLABLE`

Introduce a `Job` class which replaces the JSON response returned by the API and enables actions to be taken on the created job like `Job.get_job`, `Job.get_query_results`, and `Job.cancel`. The return type of public methods have changed and thus this is a breaking change in that you must handle the `Job` class rather than a JSON response.

name: pubsub-3.0.0
body:
### Bugfixes (BREAKING)
Improves the handling of the `SubscriberClient` future to ensure that `cancel()`ing the future works properly (rather than leaving some hanging tasks on the event loop).

As a side-effect, `subscribe()` now returns a `StreamingPullFuture` (and `run_forever` has been updated to accept this type) rather than an `asyncio.Future`. See #223 for more info.

name: bigquery-4.1.1
body:
### Dev improvement

- Fetch project ID from environment variable `BIGQUERY_PROJECT_ID` when using BQ emulator via `BIGQUERY_EMULATOR_HOST` (#214)

name: pubsub-2.1.2
body:
### Bug fixes

- Fix scope of dependency import for `gcloud.rest.pubsub.SubscriberClient` (#219)

name: pubsub-2.1.1
body:
### Bug fixes

- Reintroduce `from_google_cloud` to `gcloud.aio.pubsub.SubscriberMessage` after having been removed during a linting refactor (#216)
- Implement missing `gcloud.rest.pubsub.SubscriberMessage` which caused failures during type checking when using `gcloud.rest.pubsub.SubscriberClient` (#217)

name: pubsub-2.1.0
body:
### Features

- Added a `SubscriberClient` for `gcloud-rest-pubsub` which uses the `google-cloud-pubsub` client under the hood. The `subscribe` method is exposed but may be deprecated in the future in favour of a method for synchronously pulling PubSub messages. (#210)

name: pubsub-2.0.1
body:
### Bug fixes

- Add member variable accessors for `FlowControl` (#209)

### Documentation updates

- Update README to reflect latest `gcloud-aio-pubsub` concurrency and leasing configuration (#209)

name: pubsub-2.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes

Remove explicit dependency on `google.cloud.pubsub_v1` classes `Message`, `FlowControl`, and `Scheduler` to allow for custom `SubscriberClient` implementations that do not internally depend on `google.cloud.pubsub_v1`. Internally the `google.cloud.pubsub_v1` library is still used. (#201)

The `google.cloud.pubsub_v1` classes were encapsulated into thin `gcloud.aio` classes that provide ergonomic replacements:

* Use `gcloud.aio.pubsub.SubscriberMessage` in place of `google.cloud.pubsub_v1.subscriber.message.Message`
* Use `gcloud.aio.pubsub.FlowControl` in place of `google.cloud.pubsub_v1.types.FlowControl`
* `google.cloud.pubsub_v1.subscriber.scheduler.Scheduler` is deprecated as only the default `ThreadScheduler` is supported and in future only the `asyncio` event loop will be used for scheduling

name: storage-5.6.0
body:
### Features
* support in the `Storage` client for `download_to_filename` and `upload_from_filename` (#198)

name: auth-3.4.3
body:
### Compatibility
Deprecate support for `aiohttp < 3.3.0` -- that version is over two years old and has some pretty significant API differences which won't be compatible with v4+.

name: auth-3.4.2
body:
### Internal
* improves upon the fix for `aiohttp`'s dependency on `yarl`, which caused some compatibility issues in constrained environments such as Google Cloud Functions
   For users in these constrained environments, links have been added to help you include the correct version pins without your own app dependencies.

name: taskqueue-4.2.0
body:
### Features
- support for emulation servers
   Setting $CLOUDTASKS_EMULATOR_HOST will allow `gcloud-aio-taskqueue` to interface with an emulation server instead of hitting the official GCS APIs.

name: kms-3.3.0
body:
### Features

   Setting $KMS_EMULATOR_HOST will allow `gcloud-aio-kms` to interface with an emulation server instead of hitting the official GCS APIs.

name: bigquery-4.1.0
body:
### Features
- support for emulation servers
   Setting $BIGQUERY_EMULATOR_HOST will allow `gcloud-aio-bigquery` to interface with an emulation server instead of hitting the official GCS APIs.

name: auth-3.4.1
body:
### Internal
* hardcodes a fix for `aiohttp`'s dependency on `yarl`, which should fixup some compatibility issues in constrained environments such as Google Cloud Functions

name: auth-3.4.0
body:
### Bugfixes
* avoid unnecessary exception logs

Rather than unconditionally grabbing response bodies and logging 'em in case of failure, grab them only in the error case and toss them into the exception body.

This should improve performance around large files (we don't need to parse 'em) and avoid polluting logs (especially in successful cases where the exception is expected, eg. `.check_exists()`)

Fixes #179

name: pubsub-1.2.3
body:
### Features
* avoid requiring any sort of `google auth` when using an emulator

name: storage-5.5.4
body:
### Misc
- [gcloud-rest-storage only] avoid triggering deprecation warnings due to `python-future` issues (#175)
   See https://github.com/PythonCharmers/python-future/issues/551

name: pubsub-1.2.2
body:
### Misc
- [gcloud-rest-pubsub only] avoid triggering deprecation warnings due to `python-future` issues (#175)
   See https://github.com/PythonCharmers/python-future/issues/551

name: pubsub-1.2.0
body:
### Features
- first release of `PublisherClient` -- a fully `asyncio`-compatible Pub/Sub publishing solution. v1 includes only the basic `.publish()` method.

name: auth-3.3.1
body:
### Compatiblity
- bump max compatible requests version (verified compatible up to `< 3.0.0`)

name: storage-5.5.2
body:
### Bugfixes
- fixup an issue preventing any `.upload()` commands from working when running against a local GCS emulator

name: storage-5.5.1
body:
### Features
- avoid requiring any sort of `google auth` when using an emulator

name: storage-5.5.0
body:
### Features
- feat(storage): support for emulation servers
   Setting $STORAGE_EMULATOR_HOST will allow `gcloud-aio-storage` to interface with an emulation server instead of hitting the official GCS APIs.

name: auth-3.3.0
body:
### Features
- allow disabling ssl verification
    The goal here is to allow users to interact with insecure GCP-like systems, eg. for local emulation. Support for individual project emulators will be required in future releases to the other `gcloud-aio` libs to make full use of this.

name: auth-3.2.2
body:
### Internal / Fixes
* remove dependency on `typing` (#160) -- thanks @mozbhearsum!
       Removes the dependency for any cases where it has been built into Python (eg. Python >3.6.2). This should fix some incompatibility issues on newer versions of Python.

name: pubsub-1.1.2
body:
### Bugfixes
- make scheduled callback thread-safe (#171) -- thanks @zbarnett!

name: datastore-6.1.0
body:
### Bugfixes
- add support for timestamps without millisecond-or-higher resolution (#157) -- thanks @snstanton!

name: auth-3.2.1
body:
### Bugfixes
Fix some issues with the error handling we released in v3.2.0 which may have caused the wrong exception class to get raised for aio http errors. Thanks for the bug report and deep dive @froosty!

name: auth-3.2.0
body:
### Features
* add error logging for aio http exceptions (#166)

name: datastore-6.0.0
body:
### Bugfixes
- avoid mangling `None` queryvals (#164)

The `offset` and `limit` parameters for any Datastore queries have differing behavior between `None` and `0` values. In earlier versions of our library, we treated them the same way; so for example running a `Query(limit=0)` would return all data instead of none and initializing a `Query` from a json blob may have unintentionally set a limit which *should* have been `None` to `0`. These issues have now been resolved and we are following the same defaults as Google's official docs: `offset` and `limit` default to `None` if unset.

name: bigquery-4.0.0
body:
### Features (BREAKING)
* introduced query-based table loading and clarified insert method naming (#147) -- thanks @DaniilAnichin !

This change introduces the ability to insert into `bigquery.Table`s via a query. Unfortunately, due to naming conflicts with querying a table, we needed to move some things around to make everything clear.

* `Table.copy(..)` -> `Table.insert_via_copy(..)`
* `Table.load(..)` -> `Table.insert_via_load(..)`
* [NEW] `Table.insert_via_query(..)`

Note as well that the `load` operation has learned some new arguments: you can now specify the `autodetect` (boolean), `source_format` (see `gcloud.aio.bigquery.SourceFormat` enum), and `write_disposition` (see `gcloud.aio.bigquery.Disposition` enum). As always, information on the exact usage is in the [GCP docs](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs/insert) -- we're just mirroring their APIs.

Given the above new parameters, the `source_format` default has changed: the old `Table.load(..)` is now equivalent to `Table.insert_via_load(.., source_format=SourceFormat.DATASTORE_BACKUP)`. The new default value for `source_format` (`CSV`) lines up with the GCP API defaults.

name: storage-5.2.2
body:
### Bugfixes
- avoid using ujson:
    ujson v2+ seems to be causing recursion errors on some inputs. This
    changeset switches us to make use of the stdlib json library -- if we
    want to allow for non-stdlib json encoded use, we should make it
    user-controlled rather than implicit, anyway.

(aio-only) Fix incorrect dependency on `gcloud-rest-auth` -- it should have been `-aio-` for `gcloud-aio-bigquery`. Due to this typo, `gcloud-aio-bigquery >= 3.0.0, < 3.1.0` would have been doing synchronous Token refreshes.

name: taskqueue-4.0.0
body:
### MAJOR REFACTOR
This release marks the consolidation of [gcloud-aio](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio) and [gcloud-rest](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-rest/) into the same codebase. With this release, `gcloud-aio-taskqueue` and `gcloud-rest-taskqueue` will be generated from the same source-of-truth codebase.

Since `gcloud-aio-taskqueue` was far ahead in features, that means `gcloud-rest-taskqueue` will see a whole slew of features in this release; please read the previous `gcloud-aio-taskqueue` release notes to get caught up!

There are no new features for `gcloud-aio-taskqueue` in this release, but all future development will be on this consolidated codebase. Please pin to `gcloud-aio-taskqueue<4` until you are ready to update!

name: datastore-4.5.0

name: auth-2.2.0
body:
### Features
Allow `service_file` in `Token` constructor to be an `io.IOBase` instance, in order to support loading service accounts from memory rather than requiring a literal file. (#95)

name: auth-2.1.2
body:
### Bugfixes
Allow tokens provisioned from the GCE metadata server to use the IAM Client -- turns out this filter was a bit too narrow -- GCE metadata can also be used to access these APIs.

name: bigquery-2.1.1
body:
### Features / Bugfixes
* Make sure biquery inserts return a result (#91)

When google recieves an bigtable insert and something goes wrong, this is not reflected by the HTTP status. Instead, the response contains a report of what did and what didn't work.

Prior this change this report was silently ignored by `gcloud.aio.bigquery.Table.insert`, and there was no way to notice data problems.

Note that to capture partial errors, users need to parse the response of the `.insert()` method.

* Fix incorrect package manifests which may have been preventing type hint analysis (such as `mypy`) from properly parsing `gcloud-aio-bigquery` type hints.

name: datastore-4.4.0
body:
### Features
Add support for `geoPointValue` (#88)

name: taskqueue-3.0.0
body:
### Removals
Support for Pull Queues has been removed from this library -- the v2beta2 API (which was the last Google API to support Pull Queues) has officially been sunset, so our code may as well follow suit. The `TaskManager` has also been removed, since it relied on the usage of Pull Queues.

Push Queues are still supported and will continue to work with this library.

If you were using Pull Queues, Google recommends switching over to Pub/Sub.

name: storage-4.3.0
body:
### Features
Support for query parameters in `Storage.upload()` -- this will work for both simple and resumable uploads; for instance, optional parameters can be used to set a predefined ACL on the object, provide `kmsKeyName`, etc.

Support for setting object metadata in `Storage.upload()` -- this is supported only for resumable uploads, for now.

### Fixes
Fix incorrect internal usage of `IamClient` which may have caused `Blob.get_signed_url` to fail.

Fix incorrect package manifests which may have been preventing type hint analysis (such as `mypy`) from properly parsing `gcloud-aio-storage` type hints.

name: pubsub-1.0.1
body:
### Bugfixes
Fix kwargs expansion syntax in `create_subscription` (#85)

name: pubsub-1.0.0
body:
### Features
Complete re-write of the `SubscriptionClient` in order to fit with Google's new APIs; they built their own asynchronous version, so our release is basically a slim layer which makes GoogleStyleAsync compatible with asyncio.

name: storage-4.1.0
body:
### Features
Expose `storage.SCOPES` to help when sharing `Token` instances between multiple `gcloud-aio` projects.

Use streams as the backend storage solution for `Storage.upload` format, which should help significantly with memory usage (PR #65).

name: kms-2.1.0
body:
### Features
Expose `kms.SCOPES` to help when sharing `Token` instances between multiple `gcloud-aio` projects.

name: datastore-4.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
The `Datastore.commit()` method arguments have changed to support non-transactional usage. We have changed from:
```
async def commit(self, transaction: str, mutations: List[Dict[str, Any]], ...)
```
to
```
async def commit(self, mutations: List[Dict[str, Any]], transaction: Optional[str] = None, ...)
```

### Features
- Add support for non-GQL queries, by using the `datastore.Query` class instead of `datastore.GQLQuery`. This should be supported for all query semantics. (PR #70)

- Expose `datastore.SCOPES` to help when sharing `Token` instances between multiple `gcloud-aio` projects.

- Support non-transactional datastore usage (PR #66)

name: bigquery-2.1.0
body:
### Features
Expose `kms.SCOPES` to help when sharing `Token` instances between multiple `gcloud-aio` projects.

### Fixes
Do not raise an error when calling `Table.insert` with `rows = []`.

name: auth-2.0.1
body:
### Features
Add a warning when a user-configured path to a service file is missing (eg. raise `FileNotFoundError`).

### Bugfixes
Fix race condition in `Token.get_project()` which may have raised an `AttributeError` early in token instantiation process.

name: storage-4.0.1
body:
### Bugfixes
In release [4.0.0](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/releases/tag/storage-4.0.0), we marked the `service_file` argument to the `Storage` constructor as optional in our documentation and release notes. Unfortunately, we failed to reflect that in the code. This release fixes that issue by correcting the code -- the `service_file` argument is indeed now optional.

name: datastore-3.1.0
body:
### Features
`Datastore` will now automatically connect to a local running datastore emulator if the environment variable `DATASTORE_EMULATOR_HOST` is set, as described in [Google's emulator documentation](https://cloud.google.com/datastore/docs/tools/datastore-emulator).

name: datastore-3.0.1
body:
### Fixes
Fix retrieval of `project` name from `Token` values in the case where `Datastore` is initialized without a value for `project`.

name: bigquery-2.0.1
body:
### Fixes
Fix retrieval of `project` name from `Token` values in the case where `Table` is initialized without a value for `project`.

name: taskqueue-2.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
- The `service_file` argument to the `PullQueue`, `PushQueue`, and `TaskManager` constructors has been made optional to support the [major changes to the `Token` class](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/releases/tag/auth-2.0.0).
- The deprecated `TaskQueue` constructor has been removed -- please use `PullQueue` directly.
- The `session` kwarg for the `TaskManager` class has been removed.

name: storage-4.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
- The `service_file` argument to the `Storage` constructor has been made optional to support the [major changes to the `Token` class](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/releases/tag/auth-2.0.0).
- The `project` argument to the `Storage` constructor has been removed entirely.

name: kms-2.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
- The `service_file` argument to the `KMS` constructor has been made optional to support the [major changes to the `Token` class](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/releases/tag/auth-2.0.0).
- The `project` argument to the `KMS` constructor has been removed entirely.

name: datastore-3.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
- The `project` and `service_file` arguments to the `Datastore` constructor have been made optional to support the [major changes to the `Token` class](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/releases/tag/auth-2.0.0). If `project` is not provided, the `Token` instance's project will be used in all requests to Datastore.

name: bigquery-2.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
- `make_stream_insert` has been removed -- please use the `Table.insert()` method directly.
- `Table.insert(rows)` has been modified to accept a standard list of dictionaries rather than making use of the intermediate `make_rows` method (which has been removed).
- The `project` and `service_file` arguments to the `Table` constructor have been made optional to support the [major changes to the `Token` class](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/releases/tag/auth-2.0.0). If `project` is not provided, the `Token` instance's project will be used in all requests to BigQuery.

name: auth-2.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
The arguments to the `Token` constructor have been changed -- `project` has been removed and `service_file` is now optional. See below for more information.

### Features
We now support falling back to the GCE metadata service for authentication. This enables us to use this library in GAE, GCE, GKE, etc without provisioning a service account and providing a path to that credential file.

Additionally, this mode has been integrated with Google's new recommendations around authentication, which allowed us to make the `service_file` value completely optional.

We now attempt to authenticate in the following way:
- try the credential file provided by the `service_file` argument
- try any credentials found in the env (try `${GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS}` then `${CLOUDSDK_CONFIG}/application_default_credentials.json`)
- try the GCE metadata service

Note that as of release 1.2.0 the supported credential file types includes:
- service accounts
- application default credentials
- legacy credentials
- authorized user creds

### Minor
A new method has been added: `Token.get_project()` which returns the authenticated project, if if can be determined.

name: datastore-2.1.0
body:
### Feature
Allow custom user-overriden subclasses for eg. `Entity` and `Key` objects. See [the documentation](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/blob/21e6a735538ec18b3d17a1d866f587deef750ebd/datastore/README.rst#custom-subclasses) for more info.

name: auth-1.2.0
body:
### Features
Passing in an account-default legacy credential file (eg. `/Users/kevin/.config/gcloud/legacy_credentials/kevin@talkiq.com/adc.json`) should now be supported by all `gcloud-aio` projects in addition to service accounts. There should be no change in behavior between using a service account vs using legacy credentials.

name: taskqueue-1.6.0
body:
### Features
This release marks the release of `PushQueue` support. Like the `PullQueue` implementation, this release is one-to-one compatible with the latest push queue cloudtasks API (eg. [v2beta3](https://cloud.google.com/tasks/docs/reference/rest/)).

Note that Google is in-progress deprecating the pull queue cloudtasks API -- their recommendation is to move away from pull queues and onto Pub/Sub. Please see [gcloud-aio-pubsub](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/tree/master/pubsub) for asyncio support, if you're interested in making the switchover. `gcloud-aio-taskqueue` will not deprecate pull queue processing until the API has been completely removed by Google.

name: taskqueue-1.5.1
body:
### Deprecations
We've deprecated the `TaskQueue` name in favor of `PullQueue` to help pave the way for releasing a `PushQueue` class in the next major version. This release simply marks the former with a deprecation warning and adds the latter (with no functional differences). Please use this release to fixup your deprecations before `2.0` gets released.

### Previous Release
Please note that release [1.5.0](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/releases/tag/taskqueue-1.5.0) incorrectly renamed `TaskQueue` to `PushQueue`. Please skip that release and upgrade directly to this one!

name: taskqueue-1.5.0
body:
## Bad Release
Please skip updating to this release! We incorrectly renamed the `TaskQueue` class to `PushQueue` rather than `PullQueue`. A new release will be posted momentarily with this issue resolved. Sorry for any inconvenience!

### Deprecations
We've deprecated the `TaskQueue` name in favor of `PullQueue` to help pave the way for releasing a `PushQueue` class in the next major version. This release simply marks the former with a deprecation warning and adds the latter (with no functional differences). Please use this release to fixup your deprecations before `2.0` gets released.

name: storage-3.0.1
body:
### Features
- Expose `timeout` option in `Storage.download()` and `Storage.download_metadata()`

name: storage-3.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
This release presents breaking API changes compared to version `2.x`. Please check the following API changes carefully before upgrading!

### Highlights
- We now support upload/download of non-string-like files. The old `download_as_string()` etc. methods have been replaced with more generic `download()` methods.
- We now support upload of files larger than 5MB (eg. files which require resume-able uploads). Resumable upload can be selectively enabled for smaller files, as well.

### API Changes
- `Blob.download_as_string()` is now `Blob.download()` and will return a bytes-like object. This enables supports for non-text files! Simply convert the returned bytes into a string to achieve parity with the old behavior (eg. `bar = await foo.download_as_string()` vs. `bar = (await foo.download()).decode()`). Similarly, `Storage.download_as_string()` is now `Storage.download()`.
- Similarly, `Blob.upload_from_string(...)` is now `Blob.upload(...)` and will accept data of any type.
- `Storage.upload(...)` now handles both standard and resumable uploads, which can be controlled by passing the `UploadType` enum.

name: datastore-2.0.0
body:
### Major Changes
This release is a major milestone and is no longer backwards compatible. Please pin to `< 2.0.0` until you are ready to perform a migration -- we promise, it'll be worth it! We highly recommend checking the [Usage guide](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/tree/master/datastore#usage) to see the changes in this release.

### Features
- Support for mutations on keys of arbitrary path-length.
- Support for namespaced projects.
- Support for all Datastore API features; that includes:
    * `allocateIds`
    * `lookup`
    * `reserveIds`
    * `rollback`
    * `runQuery`

### Interface
- Accept `Key` objects instead of path/name tuples to all methods.
- Expose all configuration Enums and return types.

### Fixes
- Avoid overriding user-configured project indexing values.

name: datastore-1.1.1
body:
### DEPRECATIONS
Mark `Datastore.transact` as deprecated in favor of `Datastore.beginTransaction`. This brings us in line with the Google API docs in preparation for `gcloud-aio-datastore==2.0.0`.

name: datastore-1.1.0
body:
### DEPRECATIONS
All "top-level" methods which were technically accessible as private methods in the `datastore.py` class are now deprecated. This includes: `infer_type`, `format_timestamp`, `format_value`, `make_commit_body`, `make_mutation_record`, `make_properties`, and `make_value`. Please use the `Datastore` class interface directly.

### Features
- Support deletion (`await datastore.delete('Kind', 'name')`)
- Allow configurable timeouts in transactions (see `datastore.transact(..., timeout = 10)` and `datastore.commit(..., timeout = 10)`)

### Internal
- Prevent installation on incompatible versions of Python

name: storage-2.1.1
body:
### Fixes
- fix URI path encoding for GCP REST API (#40)

name: storage-2.1.0
body:
### Features
- implement `storage.delete()`
- `storage.upload(file_data=None)` now creates empty files

name: storage-2.0.0
body:
### Breaking Changes
The `storage` module has been heavily refactored (PR #35) -- it now performs error-checking internally rather than forcing that on the user and the old outputs to allow that external checking have now been removed.

- The `make_download` method has been removed.
- `Storage` methods now raise API errors as `HTTPError`s rather than returning an error code and a message. They now **only return the response rather than a tuple of code and response**.
- `Bucket` methods now raise API errors as `HTTPErrors`s rather than returning `None` and logging an error.

name: auth-1.1.2
body:
- retry failing token acquires (#34)
- clean up error handling in token renewal

name: taskqueue-1.4.3
body:
### Fix
- fix retry handler for `TaskQueue` operations (#32):
    - it should now _actually retry intermittent failures_
    - it should no longer replace the first error with a `RuntimeError`

name: taskqueue-1.4.2
body:
### DEPRECATIONS
- deprecate passing `session` into the `TaskManager` constructor -- this was previously a noop and will be removed entirely in a future major release (target removal: 2.0.0).

### Minor
- ensure `aiohttp.ClientSession` is created within a coroutine
- ensure the `TaskManager` session is properly reused in all cases

name: taskqueue-1.4.1
body:
### Logging
- improve log handling and message parsing

name: storage-1.0.1
body:
### Minor
- ensure `aiohttp.ClientSession` is created within a coroutine

### Fixes
- ensure session is reused in Token object (#30, thanks @Natim!)

### Internal
- use `pytest-asyncio` for cleaner tests

name: kms-1.0.1
body:
### Minor
- feat(kms): ensure `aiohttp.ClientSession` is created within a coroutine

name: datastore-1.0.1
body:
### Fixes
- prioritize user-defined `aiohttp.ClientSession` when it is passed in to methods of a `Datastore` instance rather than using the instantiated `Datastore().session`.

### Internal
- use `pytest-asyncio` for cleaner tests

name: bigquery-1.0.1
body:
### Minor
- ensure that any instances which are initialized _without_ passing in an explicit `aiohttp.ClientSession` instance also benefit from caching the default-created-session.

### Internal
- use `pytest-asyncio` to clean up tests

name: auth-1.1.1
body:
### Minor
- ensure `aiohttp.ClientSession` is created within a coroutine

name: taskqueue-1.4.0
body:
### Bugfix
- previous versions of `gcloud-aio-taskqueue` included a monkeypatch for `aiohttp.ClientResponse.raise_for_status` which turned it into a coroutine and thus caused potential incompatibilities in projects using this libraries. This release removes this behaviour.

### Internal
- use `pytest-asyncio` for cleaner tests

name: auth-1.1.0
body:
### Features
- allow usage of service accounts across GCP projects

### Internal
- cleanups to the Token class
- use `pytest-asyncio` for cleaner tests
- verify Python 3.7 support (and include in automated tests)

name: kms-1.0.0
body:
### Initial Release
- implemented `encrypt` and `decrypt`

name: taskqueue-1.3.0
body:
## WARNING
This release incorrectly monkeypatches `aiohttp.ClientResponse.raise_for_status` into being a coroutine, which will break compatibility with any code which calls `resp.raise_for_status()` (ie. rather than `await resp.raise_for_status()`). Please upgrade to `gcloud-aio-taskqueue>=1.4.0`.

### Compatibility
- fix compatibility with `aiohttp` v3.x

name: storage-1.0.0
body:
### Compatibility
- treat `ujson` as an optional dependency (fallback to `json` compatibility)
- fix compatibility with `aiohttp` v2.x and v3.x

### Internal
- remove dependency on `gcloud-aio-core`
- internal refactor and modularization

body:

### Internal

name: taskqueue-1.2.10
body:
### TaskManager
- feature: allow immediate `LeaseManager` preemption. This should drastically speed up processing times for large `batch_size`s.

name: taskqueue-1.2.9
body:
### TaskQueue
- feature: enforce single session per every poll() and process() (#20)

name: taskqueue-1.2.8
body:
### TaskManager
- fix FailFast deletion command typo

name: taskqueue-1.2.7
body:
### TaskManager
- feature: begin processing tasks immediately after lease rather than waiting for next preemption.

name: taskqueue-1.2.6
body:
### TaskManager
- feature: quit TaskManager immediately on BrokenProcessPool to avoid potential hanging state
- feature: log unhandled `TaskManager.process()` exceptions

name: taskqueue-1.2.5
body:
### TaskManager
- fix: handle BrokenProcessPool explicitly

name: taskqueue-1.2.4
body:
### TaskManager
- fix: catch pool errors in LeaseManager.stop()
- fix: mark ProcessPool as broken in all exception cases

name: taskqueue-1.2.3
body:
### TaskManager
- feature: allow in-flight tasks to be processed (ie. finish) on pool death

name: taskqueue-1.2.2
body:
### TaskManager
- fix: catch and handle edge case subprocessing errors

### TaskQueue
- fix: ensure retryable tasks can not return null

name: taskqueue-1.2.1
body:
### TaskManager
- fix executor shutdown ordering issue

### TaskQueue
- feat: raise 429 on retry exhaustion

name: taskqueue-1.2.0
body:
### TaskManager
- fix: ensure ProcessPoolExecutor shuts down cleanly on `.stop()` call
- fix: fix unbounded memory growth issue in process executors
- fix: prevent error with multiple event loops

name: taskqueue-1.1.1
body:
### TaskManager
- fix: use single `multiprocessing.Manager` instance across all processes to reduce CPU usage
- fix: ensure LeaseManager process always exits

### TaskQueue
- refactor: clean up retry/raise request handlers

name: taskqueue-1.1.0
body:
### TaskManager
- feat: lease management is now multiprocess-based, so heavy workloads should not cause lease loses

### TaskQueue
- feat: taskqueues will retry on ServerDisconnects, which may occur when making concurrent requests to Google APIs

name: taskqueue-1.0.6
body:
### TaskQueue
- minor: better logging on failed methods

name: taskqueue-1.0.5
body:
### Features
- default ClientSession now has timeout values set

### Fixes
- gracefully handle exceptions in TaskManager lease
- fix casting error when `lease_seconds` is a float

name: taskqueue-1.0.4
body:
### Features
- set default TaskManager `max_concurrency` to "infinite"
- autorenewal thread is now immediately interruptible, so processing should be overall faster in virtually all cases

### Minor
- prevent log pollution from cancelling autorenewal

name: taskqueue-1.0.3
body:
### Bugfix
- prevent autorenew failures from killing taskmanager

name: taskqueue-1.0.2
body:
### TaskManager
- do not wait for entire batch before leasing more tasks

name: taskqueue-1.0.1
body:

### Minor
- bump `gcloud-aio-core` dependency to require bugfix for string/bytes encoding

name: taskqueue-1.0.0
body:
This release migrates to Cloudtasks v2beta2. We've taken the opportunity to clean up the `TaskManager` and `TaskQueue` usage in response to this change, with the non-backwards-compatible changes described below.

### Major changes
- `deserialize_task` has been replaced with `decode` and `encode`. Usage:

```
await tq.insert(encode(payload))
leased_payload = decode((await tq.lease(num_tasks=1))['tasks'][0]['pullMessage']['payload'])
assert payload == leased_payload
```

- `TaskQueue` has been re-written from the ground up. Notable changes:
  - the constructor now accepts a `location` parameter, which you can find in your Cloudtasks dashboard
  - `insert_task, `delete_task`, and `renew_task` have been renamed to `insert, `delete`, and `renew`
  - A bunch of new methods have been added for interfacing with task entities: `ack`, `cancel`, `drain`, `get`, `lease`, `list`, and `renew`
  - The task entity format has changed with the new v2beta2 API! The most important changes are as follows:
    - `id` has been re-branded as `name`. Accordingly, `TaskQueue` methods now accept `name`s rather than `id`s.
    - Some operations (`ack`, `cancel`, `renew`) can only be performed by the consumer which originally leased that task. Accordingly, those methods now require `task` entities be passed in, rather than just `name`s, to prove that the consumer is indeed the task leaser.
    - `task['payloadBase64']` has been moved to `task['pullMessage']['payload']` (it is still base64-encoded, see above `encode` and `decode` convenience methods. `task['pullMessage']['tag']` is now exposed.
- `TaskManager` constructor has changed.
  - `task_queue` has been replaced with `project, `service_file`, and `taskqueue` (eg. the `TaskManager` instance will construct its own `TaskQueue` from these parameters). `location`, `session`, and `token` are optional values which will be passed to the `TaskQueue` constructor.
  - `poll_interval` and `max_poll_interval` have been replaced with `backoff_base` and `backoff_max_value`, and an additional parameter `backoff_factor` has been added. We now backoff exponentially according to the `backoff_factor`, rather than linearly as before.
  - `deadletter_upsert` has been renamed to `deadletter_insert_function`
  - The `worker` method *no longer decodes tasks as json objects*. This allows for support of non-json-ified payloads. If your tasks are json-encoded, the first line of your `worker` method should now be `... = json.loads(payload)`

```
OldTaskManager(self, task_queue, worker, deadletter_upsert=None, lease_seconds=10, poll_interval=1, max_poll_interval=30.0, max_concurrency=20, batch_size=1, retry_limit=50)

NewTaskManager(self, project, service_file, taskqueue, worker, backoff_base=2, backoff_factor=1.1, backoff_max_value=60, batch_size=1, deadletter_insert_function=None, lease_seconds=10, location=LOCATION, max_concurrency=20, retry_limit=None, session=None, token=None)
```

- `TaskManager` and `TaskQueue` stat collection methods have been disabled. Google plans to re-introduce these in the future, at which point we will pass those through here.
- `LocalTaskManager` has been removed, since its only real use was in stats collection. It may be re-introduced when stats collection is re-enabled, but we recommend simply mocking `TaskManager` when running tests which would have previously used the `LocalTaskManager`.
- This library no longer relies on `gcloud-aio-core`, which will gradually be phased out of all `gcloud-aio-*` libraries, or `ujson`. It does, though, now rely on `aiohttp` version `2.0.0` or greater.
- As always, see the [smoke tests](https://github.com/talkiq/gcloud-aio/tree/master/taskqueue/tests/integration) for more information

name: taskqueue-0.7.1

- feature: allow arbitrary `on_empty` method call in `LocalTaskQueue` object (eg. `LocalTaskQueue(on_empty=lambda: print(self.duration))`)
